html:
Wojciech Szczesny has extended his contract with Barcelona.

The Polish goalkeeper signed a new deal which will see him remain with the LaLiga club until 2027.

Szczesny came out of retirement last season to join Barcelona, who lost starting goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen to a long-term injury.

Szczesny, formerly of Arsenal, Roma and Juventus, played 30 times for Barcelona last season and kept 14 clean sheets.

Unfinished Business.
He’s not done yet. pic.twitter.com/C6OOvCz7SZ

— FC Barcelona (@FCBarcelona) July 7, 2025

He helped Hansi Flick’s side win the domestic treble, taking his career trophy tally to 14, and did not lose any games in LaLiga (14 wins and one draw).

Despite Ter Stegen insisting he has no plans to leave Barcelona, the extension of Szczesny’s deal along with the signing of Joan Garcia puts the German goalkeeper’s future at the club in doubt.
